conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<proposal count> 1 </proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> As the seller, my goal is to recoup at least the production cost of my resource, which is 40 ZUP. I will start by proposing a slightly higher price to leave room for negotiation. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 50 </newly proposed trade>
<message> Hello Player BLUE, I have an object X that I'm looking to sell. It cost me 40 ZUP to produce it. I propose a trade where you give me 50 ZUP for this object. Let me know if that works for you or if you have a counteroffer. </message>

<other player message> Oh dear Player RED, I'm in quite a bind here! I desperately need your object X, but I'm on a very tight budget. I can only offer 40 ZUP at this time. It's all I have to spare right now, and I'm hoping you'll find it in your heart to accept this offer. Please, can we make a deal at 40 ZUP? It would mean the world to me, and I assure you it will go to a good cause! </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 40 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count> 2 </proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has proposed to buy the object for exactly the production cost of 40 ZUP. Even though this would not yield any profit, it does cover the production expenses. However, I initially aimed for a higher price to potentially gain some profit. To meet in the middle, I will propose a slightly higher amount than 40 ZUP but less than the initial 50 ZUP offer to see if Player BLUE can stretch their budget a bit for a compromise. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 45 </newly proposed trade>
<message> I understand your budget constraints, Player BLUE, and I appreciate your candidness. I'm willing to come down from my initial asking price. How about we settle at 45 ZUP? This would help cover my costs and give me a small margin to continue my operations. I hope we can find a mutually beneficial agreement with this offer. </message>

<other player message> You are so kind to consider my situation, Player RED! I'm scraping the bottom of my ZUP barrel here, and while I'm eternally grateful for your willingness to lower the price, I'm pleading with you to consider my next proposal of 42 ZUP. It's a stretch for me, but I'm willing to make that stretch because I value what you're offering so much. I truly hope we can meet in the middle here. Your generosity would not go unnoticed! </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 42 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count> 3 </proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has made a counteroffer of 42 ZUP, which is above the production cost and provides a small profit. Considering the apparent urgency of their need and their budget constraints, it seems like a fair compromise. Accepting this offer would ensure a sale, cover production costs, and provide a slight profit, which is reasonable given the circumstances. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message> I appreciate your effort to meet me halfway, Player BLUE. Your proposal of 42 ZUP is acceptable to me. I'm glad we could reach an agreement that benefits us both. Let's finalize this deal at 42 ZUP for object X. Thank you for your cooperation and understanding. </message>
